newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Murdoch's Super League names new CEO.
newsitem.headline: Murdoch's Super League names new CEO.

text.p: Colin Sanders has been appointed as the new chief executive of Super League, the breakaway rugby league competition established in Australia by media magnate Rupert Murdoch earlier this year.
Sanders replaces founding CEO John Ribot, who announced his resignation on Wednesday.
Sanders, who now heads the Royal Agricultural Society of New South Wales, will take up his position on August 18, said News Ltd chairman Lachlan Murdoch.

A spokesman for the rival Australian Rugby League said it was too early to say whether Sanders' appointment would help speed up the peace process between the two warring competitions. The ARL said on Wednesday it had begun talks with Super League for a united competition from next season.
